faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase Spanish property without nationality restrictions. Non-EU citizens require documentation (passport, tax identification number), but no visa or residency requirement exists for property ownership. British buyers post-Brexit retain identical purchasing rights. Most investors work through Spanish lawyers (€1,500-2,000 typical costs) to ensure documentation compliance.

Some regions offer reduced transfer tax rates. Annual holding costs include IBI (property tax) approximately €300-400, community fees €1,200-1,500 annually, utilities €150-200 monthly depending on usage.

faqs.question: How do property taxes work in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spanish property taxation includes: IBI (annual property tax) €300-400 for this property, based on cadastral value; Income Tax on rental earnings at progressive rates (19-45% depending on total income); Transfer Tax (7% on purchase, paid once). British residents must declare Spanish rental income to HMRC. Professional property management companies handle tax documentation (€60-80 monthly cost), simplifying compliance for absent investors.
